TopicTitle: Devnote Tuesdays: The Really Short Edition

Articles.Content:
<p><strong><img src="https://31.media.tumblr.com/0ff9377afa68dc3ad3fe6844aaf1bd38/tumblr_inline_nc0v4dJ9qh1rr2wit.jpg"/></strong></p>

<p><strong>Anthony (Rowsdower):</strong> As you can see, today’s devnotes are super, super short. Most of the staff has been out in celebration of Mexican Independence Day. Others have been working furiously through the final stretches of QA to bring us extremely close to being in experimentals, so their talk time has been rather limited. Expect an announcement soon. On another note, I’m pleased to announce the newest member of <a href="http://bit.ly/1knMaSg"><strong>KSP-TV</strong></a> - <a href="http://bit.ly/ZoKRMJ"><strong>DKlarations</strong></a>! He plays through what he likes to call “Iron Man” mode. Toss in a ton of mods and a bit of theatrical flair and you’ve got yourself an entertaining stream. Watch him every Thursday night at 7pm EDT.</p>

<p><strong>Jim (Romfarer)</strong><span><strong>:</strong> This week i have updated all the prefabs and atlases use to run the EzGUIÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s. This work has definitely decreased the size of the GUI atlases overall. They should all use slightly less memory now. The biggest benefit in this was probably the introduction of a new generic atlas which holds all of the standard gui elements. I also spent some time changing the way we spawn some of the GUI prefabs by removing some double instances of the same GUI. Specifically the crew management interface used in the launch dialog and the editors are now using the same prefab. Same thing goes for the Astronaut complex in space center and editors. Ideally it should have zero impact on gameplay but it removes the multiple maintenance problem of updating two copies of the same GUI.</span></p>

<p><strong>Bob (Calisker):</strong><span> As we get closer to update 0.25, IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢m starting to look at whatÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s coming and how we can share some of the more exciting elements with the press. WeÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re also working on a few marketing programs that are still in development, but each of them have me excited. IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢m personally excited with how things are coming together for update 0.25. IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢m still a relatively new part of the team but itÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s remarkable to see the progress made in the game since I joined last summer. </span></p>

<p><strong>Ted (Ted):</strong><span> This past week has been a very, very busy one. We’re in the run up to Experimentals, so it’s been all engines at full throttle. I’ve been taking care of last-minute issue triage to see if we can cram any more pre-0.25 issue fixes into 0.25. Furthermore, I’ve been helping out with the final week of QA that we’re doing on 0.25, giving the SP+ parts a good ol’ thrashing. Additionally, it’s been an exciting week running up to Experimentals, the new testers are looking forward to getting their hands mucky with the goo of many, many Kerbals. Right now, I’m making sure all our Experimental Testers are familiar with the 0.25 features that are going to require much testing and that QA is coming to an end nicely, with nothing left trailing that shouldn’t be. Overall, a pretty busy week, but I’d be lying if I said I didn’t enjoy it!</span><span><br/></span></p>

oh wow

Thats alotta progress to .25 but y so short??

*Removed* I guess I ninjaed the above poster... Ignore this....

Anyways, nice notes, even if they had to be cut short a little. Looking forward to the update! Any chance .25 will fix those claw and asteroid bugs (there's quite a few of them) from .23.5?

Hey Rowsdower, just wondering about the dev process. with .25 in QA and "in the run up to experimentals", does that mean that some of what they are working on now is for .26? When does work completely stop on .25?

What I meant was that we're nearing the end of QA and readying up for the next phase, which is experimentals. Work won't *completely* stop on 0.25 until we're satisfied with the released product - ie. will we have to fix some additional bugs post-launch and release 0.25.1 and so forth?

The fact that it flies is just sad really.

Yet more proof we need better aero. Dev notes were ok, though could you please reveal the feature? If .25 will be in experimental's SoonÃ¢â€žÂ¢ (two weeks?), the feature won't change much will it?

So short its disappointing.....
